caption.p: Schematic diagram of NP and M2e fusions. NPM2e: the full-length NP (498 amino acids) precedes one copy of M2e (23 amino acids); M2eNP: one copy of M2e precedes the full-length of NP; 4M2eNP: four copies of M2e precede the full-length of NP; 4M2eNPs: four copies of M2e precede truncated NPs (314 amino acids).
